author: vors

comments.author: rkeithhill
comments.body: Just out of curiosity, why remove this?  On the projects I work on, they use `username/topic-name` for private user branches (bug fixes, feature impls) and `feature-name` for shared feature branches.  This makes it easy to identify a dev's private branch from shared feature branches.  The `/` character also results in a nice, tree-view display in Visual Studio's Branches tool window. :-)

comments.author: vors
comments.body: We don't plan to use the main repo for **private dev branches**. Devs are working from their forks (mostly). Current guidelines could still be applied, but since fork name already provides a moniker, it's not that important.

comments.author: rkeithhill
comments.body: Ah yeah, that makes sense.  Thanks.

title: Update branch naming in git documentation
